intro: Epinetrum delagoense, commonly known as the Delagoense Epine, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Epinetrum delagoense is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh conditions.
